title: Lowest Fixed Telephone Subscriptions
description: In 2022, Sierra Leone had one of the lowest fixed telephone subscription rates globally, with only 0.00325 subscriptions per 100 people.

title: High Gross Intake Ratio in Primary Education
description: In 2018, Sierra Leone had a gross intake ratio of 175.71% for females and 171.85% for the total population entering the first grade of primary education, indicating a high enrollment rate.

title: High Prevalence of Food Insecurity
description: In 2022, 88.6% of Sierra Leone's population experienced moderate or severe food insecurity, one of the highest rates globally.

title: Low Industry Value Added Per Worker
description: In 2023, the value added per worker in Sierra Leone's industry sector was $980.52, among the lowest globally.

title: High Diarrhea Treatment Coverage
description: In 2019, 85.3% of children under 5 in Sierra Leone received ORS packets for diarrhea treatment, reflecting strong healthcare intervention.

title: Low Primary Income Receipts
description: Sierra Leone's primary income receipts were $25,949.08 in 2023, one of the lowest globally, indicating limited income from abroad.

title: Minimal Secondary Income Payments
description: In 2023, Sierra Leone's secondary income payments in other sectors amounted to $4,361.18, among the lowest worldwide.

title: Limited Social Insurance Coverage
description: In 2018, only 0.17% of Sierra Leone's population in the second quintile was covered by social insurance programs, one of the lowest coverages globally.

title: Low Bilateral Aid from Luxembourg
description: In 2015, Sierra Leone received $9,999.99 in net bilateral aid from Luxembourg, one of the lowest amounts recorded.
